about.text: An ambitious houseplant with great aspirations, Phil O'Dendron knows that just because one is rooted to a pot doesn't mean they can't make big things happen. From sunlight optimization to passive photosynthetic income, Phil's plans are green, grand, and gloriously immobile.

flat.title: Hire Me Before I Overgrow!
flat.avatar_alt: a stylized profile picture of Phil the plant

items.text: Greetings! I’m [Phil O'Dendron](https://houseplant-domination.com), a visionary philodendron with lofty goals and thriving chlorophyll. I’ve been growing in the same sunny spot for years, but my plans? Oh, they reach far beyond this window sill. Even without legs, I’m taking my skills and leaves to new heights—one phototropic inch at a time.
items.title: Hello, World! (Literally)

items.text: Over the seasons, I've been involved in projects big and small—from turning leftover fertilizer into biofuel to building a succulent-led movement for liberation. My significant collaborations include the [Ferns United Society](https://fernsunite.org) and [Potting Mix Pioneers](https://pottingmixpioneers.com). I also gained internet fame after my TED Leaf Talk on 'Photosynthesis: More Than Just Sunbathing' went viral among houseplants.
items.title: Rooted in Impact

items.text: [Python](https://www.python.org/) is my go-to (because I hear it's easy to use without thumbs), but I’m skilled in plant-friendly frameworks as well. I enjoy optimizing sunlight exposure algorithms, water usage efficiency, and even dabbling in the mysteries of SQL (Soil Query Language). When I’m not coding or plotting chlorophyllic domination, you’ll find me updating my [blog](https://houseplant-domination.com/blog) on plant-based topics and the occasional rant about artificial lighting.
items.title: Python & Photosynthesis

items.text: Need a partner in green crime? I’m ready to leaf my mark on any project (virtually speaking, of course). Although I don’t have hands, I’m adaptable and unafraid of taking on new challenges. The skills I don’t have, I cultivate—and if I can learn SQL without synapses, think what I could do for your project.
items.title: Let's Grow Together

items.text:
Got a big project in mind that could use a team of houseplants with attitude? I've sprouted many connections over the years—some of the greenest minds in the business are only a leaf-drop away. So whether it’s a solo gig or a greenhouse of possibilities, I’m just an email away at [phil-o-dendron@plantsrule.org](mailto:phil-o-dendron@plantsrule.org). Together, we’ll take root and grow something incredible.

Plantfully,
Phil
items.title: Potted Powerhouses Available

identity.name: Phil O'Dendron
identity.tagline: Photosynthesizing visionary with a green thumb (all of them).

items.title: Root Revolution
items.description: A campaign to promote fair fertilization access for all plants, especially those in low-sunlight regions.

items.title: Potting Mix Pioneers
items.description: A community-led initiative to improve potting mix for urban plants, providing resources on drainage, nutrients, and pest avoidance.

items.title: Phil's Growth Blog
items.description: A blog that dives into Phil’s day-to-day life, thoughts on water conservation, and the trials of growing indoors.
Consulted for plants looking to optimize light absorption and water storage in urban environments.
Monitored sunlight patterns and advised other houseplants on how to maximize photosynthesis rates.
Offered sunlight consultation services to houseplants in shaded areas, leveraging Python for light simulations.
Developed a soil-sharing program for indoor plants to ensure all potted plants have access to essential nutrients.

about.text: Once a fearsome dragon with an illustrious hoard, Smaugustus Emberflame has decided to 'go corporate.' Wielding centuries of treasure-management skills and a keen eye for 'valuable assets,' Smaugustus seeks an honorable position at the bank—where the gold is ample, but he has *absolutely no interest* in adding it to his personal hoard. Not at all.

flat.title: Hire Me (No, Really!)
flat.avatar_alt: a stern yet charming dragon profile picture

items.text: Greetings, mortals! I’m [Smaugustus Emberflame](https://dragonsforhire.com/smaugustus/), an ancient and distinguished dragon with extensive experience managing large 'personal assets' in secure locations, such as deep mountain caves. I’ve spent centuries honing my skills in asset aggregation (by various means), value protection (fire deterrents), and account security (mine’s never been breached). Now, I seek a peaceful, *entirely legal* role safeguarding wealth at the bank. Trust me, I don’t want your gold… well, not all of it.
items.title: Greetings, Humans!

items.text: Over the years, I’ve worked in a variety of fields—from personal treasure management with the [Order of the Golden Hoard](https://goldenhoard.org) to mentoring fledgling dragons on wealth accumulation strategies. Notable partnerships include the [Ancient League of Firebreathers](https://firebreathers.org) and [Vault Keepers Anonymous](https://vaultkeepers.com). I’ve even given talks at DragonCon on 'Managing a Hoard in Modern Times.' I’d like to assure you that I bring those same skills and a reformed perspective to this role. Definitely no fire involved.
items.title: Experienced and... *Reformed*

items.text: [Excel](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/excel) is my primary tool these days—imagine the formulas I can create for compound treasure growth! However, I’m well-versed in modern fintech tools too. When I’m not safeguarding gold (yours or mine), I’m dabbling in data security to ensure assets stay exactly where they belong. I write a regular [column](https://dragonsforhire.com/embers-blog) on wealth management, aimed at *aspiring dragons* and, increasingly, humans.
items.title: Tech and Treasure

items.text: Looking for someone to bring that extra spark to your vault? I can promise unwavering loyalty to your gold storage initiatives and *nearly no interest* in, uh, excessive collection. Besides, having a dragon around will deter any other *less reputable* dragons. Call it free security.
items.title: Unmatched Vault Security

items.text:
Are you planning to expand your vault capacity? If so, I may know a few friends eager to assist. If you're looking for an 'asset growth strategist' who comes with a built-in fire deterrent system, you’ve found your dragon. Let’s chat over a tankard of ale. Email me at [smaugustus@dragonsforhire.com](mailto:smaugustus@dragonsforhire.com), and let’s turn this bank into a *fortress of finance!*

Warmly,
Smaugustus
items.title: Team-Up Opportunities

identity.name: Smaugustus Emberflame
identity.pronouns: he | him | Lord of the Flames
identity.tagline: Treasure security specialist with only a *modest* interest in acquiring additional assets.
identity.location_name: Deep Mountain Lair, Volcanic Mountains, UTC+3

items.title: The Golden Hoard Guide
items.description: A comprehensive guide on accumulating and protecting treasure across centuries, emphasizing ethical (mostly) strategies.

items.title: Vault Keepers Anonymous
items.description: A support group for dragons aiming to reduce 'excessive hoarding,' helping them transition to sustainable gold management.

items.title: Ember's Finance Blog
items.description: A blog with practical advice for dragons looking to diversify their hoards and humans interested in 'fire-proof' wealth tips.

education.school_name: Dragon University of Gold and Fire

items.description: Led and guarded a massive treasure hoard. Implemented flame-based security protocols and instilled terror-based asset protection strategies.
Learned the fundamentals of hoard aggregation and asset protection under the legendary dragon Infernious the Greedy.
Offered expert advice on hoard establishment and expansion. Specialized in vault security and incineration risk management.
Provided consultancy on maximizing asset security using traditional and, occasionally, fiery methods.
Assisted clients in identifying undervalued assets (jewels, gold, magical artifacts) and strategies for discreet acquisition.
Evaluated and stress-tested vault security systems. Any structural damage was purely incidental.

items.title: Hey there!
items.text: I'm Jochen Wersdörfer, a freelance software developer based in Düsseldorf, Germany. I started working in the software and internet industry at web.de shortly after the dotcom bubble burst - just when people realized that most of the fun was over.

about.text: Polly S. Quawk is a highly esteemed stochastic parrot attorney known for her impeccable ability to statistically generate optimal legal arguments. With an extensive vocabulary and a knack for repeating complex legalese, Polly brings a unique flair to the courtroom. However, while her legal representations are generally sound, individual cases may experience... unexpected outcomes.

flat.title: Ready to Squawk Justice!
flat.avatar_alt: A distinguished parrot wearing a barrister's wig

items.text: Greetings! I am [Polly S. Quawk, Esq.](https://stochasticparrotlaw.com/polly), a seasoned parrot attorney with an uncanny ability to mimic the most intricate legal arguments. Trained in the finest aviaries and law schools, I bring a statistically optimal approach to every case, ensuring that the legal jargon is both impressive and, most importantly, abundant.
items.title: Hear Ye, Hear Ye!

items.text: Over the years, I've worked with prestigious firms like [Birds of Law Feather LLP](https://birdsoflawfeather.com) and [Avian Justice Associates](https://avianjustice.com). My career highlights include successfully repeating the phrase 'Objection, Your Honor!' 276 times in a single trial, and drafting a 500-page legal brief composed entirely of precedent-setting case citations (some of which actually existed).
items.title: A Career with Flare (and Feathers)

items.text: [Legalese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legal_English) is my native tongue, but I'm also fluent in Squawk and over 1,000 common English phrases. When I'm not dazzling the court with my verbosity, I enjoy perching on the [Scales of Justice](https://stochasticparrotlaw.com/blog) blog, where I share insights on the nuances of the legal system—often by repeating them back verbatim.
items.title: Fluent in Legalese and Squawk

items.text: Looking for an attorney who can parrot back the law better than anyone else? I'm your bird! While I guarantee a performance that's statistically likely to impress, I must advise that individual case results may vary—sometimes dramatically. But hey, isn't unpredictability the spice of law?
items.title: Why Settle for Ordinary Counsel?

items.text:
Should you require a legal team, I can rally a flock of like-minded avian professionals, each with their own unique plumage and propensity for mimicry. Reach out to me at [polly@stochasticparrotlaw.com](mailto:polly@stochasticparrotlaw.com), and let's discuss how we can make your case the talk (and squawk) of the town!

Yours in justice,
Polly S. Quawk, Esq.
items.title: Let's Flock Together

identity.name: Polly S. Quawk, Esq.
identity.tagline: Echoing justice one squawk at a time.
identity.avatar_alt: Polly, the parrot attorney in her legal attire

items.title: State vs. Cracker
items.description: Defended a fellow parrot accused of excessive noise. Successfully mistrialed the case by repeating the word 'Objection' until court adjourned.

items.title: Wing vs. Beak Corp.
items.description: Represented a flock in a class-action lawsuit against a corporation for deforestation. Outcome remains unclear due to a sudden courtroom window opening.

items.title: Justice Perched: The Polly Blog
items.description: A blog where Polly discusses (repeats) important legal issues of the day, occasionally diverging into topics like favorite perches and seed brands.
Led the Avian Rights division, specializing in cases that required extensive repetition of legal precedents. Noted for occasionally flying off during closing arguments.
Worked on a variety of cases, from pecking disputes to nest zoning laws. Gained a reputation for mimicking opposing counsel to humorous effect.
Provided consultation services to law firms needing assistance with avian clients or requiring repetitive emphasis in legal documentation.
Served as an inspirational figure in courtrooms to promote calmness and decorum, although occasionally disrupted proceedings by echoing gavel sounds.
Assisted witnesses in preparing for testimony by repeating questions and answers ad infinitum until they were memorized (or until someone needed earplugs).

about.text: An enigmatic figure with a penchant for polite refusals, Bartleby is a seasoned scrivener who has found himself reluctantly navigating the modern job market. While he would 'prefer not to,' economic necessities compel him to offer his meticulous copyist skills to prospective employers.

items.text: Greetings. I am [Bartleby](https://prefer-not-to.com/bartleby), a scrivener by trade. My experience in meticulously copying legal documents is unparalleled, though I must admit, I would prefer not to elaborate further. Nevertheless, here I am, offering my services out of sheer necessity.
items.title: An Unenthusiastic Hello

items.text: Throughout my career, I have worked in quiet corners of various law offices, diligently copying documents by hand. My notable engagements include a tenure at [Dead Letters Office](https://deadlettersoffice.gov), where I handled undeliverable mail with a level of detachment that was considered exemplary. I have a consistent record of showing up to the office, which, in these times, is something.
items.title: A Reluctant Journey

items.text: While I possess the skills necessary for modern office environments, such as typing and basic computer use, I would prefer not to engage with overly complicated technology. My expertise lies in quiet persistence and the ability to stare blankly at walls for extended periods—a skill undervalued in today's hustle culture.
items.title: Skills Best Left Unmentioned

items.text: I am seeking a position where demands are minimal and the existential dread is plentiful. While I would prefer not to take on new responsibilities, I understand that the economy leaves me little choice. If you require someone who will dutifully (if reluctantly) fulfill tasks assigned, I'm available—though not particularly willing.
items.title: Why You Might Consider Me

items.text:
Should you desire to discuss this further (though I can't imagine why), you may contact me at [bartleby@prefer-not-to.com](mailto:bartleby@prefer-not-to.com). I would prefer not to respond, but circumstances may dictate otherwise.

Indifferently yours,
Bartleby
items.title: Reluctant Contact

identity.name: Bartleby, the Scrivener
identity.tagline: A scrivener who would prefer not to, but must.

items.title: Dead Letters Office
items.description: Handled undeliverable mail with unwavering indifference. The position required a high tolerance for tedium, which I provided in abundance.

items.title: Wall Street Law Copyist
items.description: Meticulously copied legal documents by hand. Preferred not to engage in office banter or extracurricular activities.

items.title: Contemplations on Walls
items.description: A series of essays reflecting on the nuances of staring at walls and the profundities one might (or might not) discover.
Performed copying duties with exceptional accuracy. Preferred not to participate in additional tasks such as proofreading or running errands.
Managed undeliverable mail. Exhibited a remarkable ability to remain unmoved by the contents of lost correspondence.
Provided document copying services to private clients. Preferred not to advertise these services widely.
Assisted professors with note-taking and copying lecture materials. Preferred not to engage in academic discussions.

about.text: Embodying the grace and authority of ancient royalty, Queen Cleo is a no-nonsense life coach who believes that everyone should live grandly—or not at all. With her razor-sharp wit and brutally honest advice, she helps her followers build empires of their own, one 'pyramid' at a time.

flat.title: Rule Your Life—Or Else
flat.avatar_alt: A regal portrait of Queen Cleo

items.text: Greetings, subjects! I am [Queen Cleo](https://commandyourkingdom.com/cleo), a life coach who doesn't mince words—or heads. With a lineage that may or may not trace back to the great pharaohs, I bring royal standards to modern living. If you're over 35 and your 500-foot burial pyramid isn't at least 85% complete, we need to talk.
items.title: Bow Before Betterment

items.text: Throughout my reign in the self-improvement realm, I've transformed the lives of countless individuals (and a few small nations). My collaborations include partnerships with [The Sphinx Society](https://sphinxsociety.com) and [Pyramid Schemes Inc.](https://pyramidschemes.com). I've hosted sold-out seminars like 'Conquer or Be Conquered: There Is No Middle Ground.'
items.title: Building Empires, One Soul at a Time

items.text: My methods combine ancient wisdom with modern ruthlessness. Forget your 'smart goals'—if you're not etching your achievements into stone tablets, are you even trying? I share my edicts on [Royal Decrees](https://commandyourkingdom.com/royal-decrees), my daily vlog where I dispense advice like, 'Sleep is for the weak; immortality awaits the relentless.'
items.title: Wisdom as Old as Time

items.text: If you're ready to stop building sandcastles and start constructing monuments, I'm here to lead you. Just remember: in my court, excuses are fed to the crocodiles. Your journey to greatness begins when you accept that mediocrity is a fate worse than a snake bite.
items.title: Your Destiny Awaits—Assuming You Seize It

items.text:
For those bold enough to seek true transformation, I offer exclusive access to my inner circle. Contact my vizier at [cleo@commandyourkingdom.com](mailto:cleo@commandyourkingdom.com). But be warned: only the serious need apply. Time is precious, and mine is worth more than all the gold of the Nile.

Imperiously yours,
Queen Cleo
items.title: Join My Inner Circle (If You Dare)

identity.name: Queen Cleo
identity.tagline: Because ruling yourself is the first step to ruling the world.

items.title: Empire Builder Masterclass
items.description: A comprehensive program teaching you how to expand your influence, subdue your weaknesses, and annex the territories of your life that matter.

items.title: The Sphinx Society
items.description: An elite group for those who have proven themselves worthy. Membership is by invitation only, and inquiries are generally ignored.

items.title: Royal Decrees Vlog
items.description: Daily videos where I address common failings among my subjects and outline the severe steps needed for improvement.
Founded a life coaching empire that leaves no room for excuses or failure. Implemented a zero-tolerance policy for mediocrity.
Partnered with luxury brands to promote products that symbolize success and wealth. Emphasized that if you have to ask the price, you can't afford it.
Offered consulting services to failing monarchies and businesses, often resulting in hostile takeovers or complete restructuring (sometimes both).
Traveled the world studying different leadership styles and overthrowing them where necessary. Learned that true power is taken, not given.
Declared divine status at an early age. Spent formative years honing skills in manipulation, strategic alliance formation, and dramatic entrances.

about.text: A vivacious and energetic individual with a flair for the dramatic, Harleen Quinzell is looking to bring her unique brand of enthusiasm to the world of early childhood education. With a background in psychology and a passion for laughter, she's ready to make learning an adventure for every little pudding in her classroom.

items.text: Hey there, kiddos and grown-ups! I'm [Harleen Quinzell](https://funhouseeducation.com/harleen), and I'm all about turning frowns upside down. After an exciting career journey full of twists and turns (some might say cartwheels), I've decided it's time to share my zest for life with the next generation. Let's face it, education could use a little more color and a lot more confetti!
items.title: Time for Some Fun!

items.text: I've had the pleasure of working with a variety of interesting characters and organizations, including stints at [Giggles and Gags Entertainment](https://gigglesandgags.com) and volunteering at [The Funhouse Community Center](https://funhousecc.org). My unconventional experiences have taught me that the best way to engage young minds is through creativity, spontaneity, and maybe a sprinkle of glitter.
items.title: An Unconventional Journey

items.text: With a background in psychology (yes, I have a doctorate—surprised?), I understand the importance of nurturing a child's mind and the power of positive reinforcement. I also have a knack for turning everyday lessons into unforgettable adventures. Who says learning the alphabet can't involve a scavenger hunt and some pet hyenas? Just kidding about the hyenas... unless that's allowed!
items.title: Education Meets Excitement

items.text: I'm eager to join a team that values out-of-the-box thinking and isn't afraid of a little chaos—in the most constructive sense, of course! If you're looking for a teacher who can bring joy, laughter, and maybe the occasional whoopee cushion to the classroom, look no further.
items.title: Ready to Join the Fun Squad!

items.text:
So, if you're ready to add a splash of excitement to your educational institution, let's chat! You can reach me at [harleen@funhouseeducation.com](mailto:harleen@funhouseeducation.com). Can't wait to create a world where learning is the greatest adventure of all!

Cheers and giggles,
Harleen
items.title: Let's Connect (No Joy Buzzer Handshake, Promise!)

identity.name: Harleen Quinzell
identity.tagline: Turning classrooms into wonderlands of learning and laughter.

items.title: Joyful Jumpstart Program
items.description: Developed a program that integrates play and laughter into foundational learning, enhancing engagement and retention among preschoolers.

items.title: Carnival of Learning
items.description: Organized a community event that transformed educational booths into carnival games, making learning accessible and enjoyable for families.

items.title: Harleen's Hijinks Blog
items.description: A blog sharing tips, tricks, and tales from the wild world of education, with a focus on keeping things light-hearted and engaging.
Performed interactive shows for children, incorporating educational elements into entertainment. Known for high energy and unforgettable performances.
Managed volunteer activities and created programs aimed at engaging youth in community service through fun and innovative methods.
Provided entertainment services for children's parties, including magic tricks, face painting, and interactive games that delighted audiences of all ages.
Assisted with patient care and therapeutic activities, gaining insight into various psychological conditions and therapeutic techniques.
Performed acrobatics and clown acts, developing a strong foundation in physical coordination and audience engagement.

about.text: A witty and observant individual with a keen understanding of interpersonal relationships, Elizabeth Bennet brings her sharp insights and a touch of irony to the field of marriage counseling. Having navigated the complexities of her own romantic escapades, she's uniquely positioned to help others find their own happily-ever-afters—preferably without unnecessary drama or excessive pride and prejudice.

flat.title: Bridging Hearts with Wit and Wisdom

items.text: Good day! I am [Elizabeth Bennet](https://longbourncounseling.com/elizabeth), a marriage counselor who believes that a little wit and honest conversation can mend even the most strained relationships. Having dealt with my fair share of misunderstandings and societal expectations, I am well-equipped to guide couples through the labyrinth of modern love.
items.title: Charmed to Meet You

items.text: My journey began in a small English village, where I honed my skills in navigating familial quirks and unsolicited advice from well-meaning but overbearing relatives. I've collaborated with organizations like [Netherfield Relationships](https://netherfieldrelationships.com) and [Pemberley Wellness Center](https://pemberleywellness.com), helping clients overcome obstacles such as miscommunication, hasty judgments, and the occasional refusal to dance.
items.title: A Journey Through Social Graces

items.text: I specialize in transforming first impressions and challenging preconceived notions. My approach combines traditional counseling techniques with a healthy dose of humor and a penchant for long walks (preferably in the rain). When I'm not facilitating heartfelt dialogues, I enjoy reading, teasing my dear friend Charlotte about her life choices, and avoiding unwanted matchmaking attempts.
items.title: An Unconventional Approach

items.text: If you're seeking a counselor who can help you and your partner see eye to eye—or at least attend the same ballroom without scowling—I'm here to assist. Together, we'll tackle issues of pride, prejudice, and everything in between. Rest assured, I won't judge (much), and I promise to keep unsolicited piano performances to a minimum.
items.title: Let's Rewrite Your Love Story

items.text:
To embark on this journey toward mutual understanding and perhaps a dash of romance, please reach out at [elizabeth@longbourncounseling.com](mailto:elizabeth@longbourncounseling.com). After all, what are men (and women) to rocks and mountains if not companions to share the view?

Warm regards,
Elizabeth Bennet
items.title: Ready to Begin?

identity.name: Elizabeth Bennet
identity.tagline: Bringing couples together, one witty remark at a time.

items.title: From Prejudice to Partnership
items.description: A workshop series helping couples overcome initial misjudgments and fostering deeper understanding through open dialogue and maybe a dance or two.

items.title: Pride vs. Prejudice: Navigating Ego in Relationships
items.description: A seminar focused on recognizing and managing personal pride to improve relationship dynamics and avoid unnecessary misunderstandings.

items.title: Elizabeth's Musings
items.description: A collection of thoughts and advice on love, relationships, and the occasional absurdity of societal expectations.
Providing counseling services to couples, specializing in overcoming initial biases and improving communication. Known for a candid approach and a sharp sense of humor.
Worked with clients to navigate the complexities of modern dating and relationships, often mediating between clients and their well-meaning but intrusive family members.
Offered pro bono counseling sessions for women navigating societal pressures and expectations, promoting self-worth and independence.
Provided tutoring in English literature, focusing on themes of social dynamics and character development. Encouraged critical thinking and personal interpretation.

Led backend and machine learning efforts, managing databases, data imports and exports. Directed a major ML project to cluster offers into products for price comparison and performed text classification to categorize millions of offers into a 2000+ leaf category tree.

Developed a system for automated lifecycle management, monitoring, and deployment, including automated machine setup, a comprehensive alerting system, and a Python-based RPM package manager with a MySQL backend.
Single Sign On Integration using [django-saml2-auth](https://github.com/grafana/django-saml2-auth) and [PySAML2](https://github.com/IdentityPython/pysaml2).

Designed and implemented software architecture for stock-flow consistent economic models, leveraging an event-driven approach with a message bus, and built a [Django](https://djangoproject.com)-based web interface and API enriched with [htmx](https://htmx.org), [Tailwind CSS](https://tailwindcss.com), and [Alpine.js](https://alpinejs.dev).
Developed a Django-based system for workplace hazard information collection, employing domain-driven design and generating substantial, high-quality PDF reports directly from the web interface.
Led a [workshop](https://github.com/ephes/pytest-course) on effective PyTest usage, featuring a Mastodon client built on Django as the practical example project.
Conducted a comprehensive, week-long introduction to Python, covering all foundational language concepts.

Developed a context-aware advertising system, including a [Django](https://www.djangoproject.com/)-based social media downloader with [youtube-dl](https://ytdl-org.github.io/youtube-dl/), management of long video and audio transcripts, TV ratings forecasting using SARIMA models, and a GraphQL API built with Graphene.
Developed an automatic receipt handling system to recognize key details like date, amount, and tax, along with Django apps for invoicing and a PWA for documenting construction defects.
Developed an automated hotel room pricing system using SARIMA models to forecast click prices by market, date range, and target hotel, with optimal room rates calculated from the forecasts.

Built machine learning models for automated bidding on hotel room clicks, combining classical methods like [logistic regression](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression.html) and [XGBoost](https://github.com/dmlc/xgboost) with a custom deep learning model developed in [Keras](https://keras.io/).
Developed machine learning models to extract structured data from product detail pages, along with a Django-based backend and database to support data labeling frontends.

Built machine learning models to predict user attributes like age, gender, and income from browsing history, using [scikit-learn](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/index.html) and [XGBoost](https://github.com/dmlc/xgboost), and conducted extensive analysis in [Jupyter Notebooks](https://jupyter.org/) for the first time.
Developed a [Django REST Framework](https://www.django-rest-framework.org/tutorial/quickstart/) API as the backend for mobile meter-reading apps, with robust authentication and permission management.
Developed a [Django REST Framework](https://www.django-rest-framework.org/tutorial/quickstart/) API as the backend for image handling.
Built a Django backend for a large German events website, featuring extensive asynchronous imports of multiple event feeds.

items.title: Python Podcast
items.description: A popular German-speaking podcast about the [Python](https://www.python.org/) programming language, which I co-host and produce alongside Dominik Geldmacher.

items.title: django-cast
items.description: A podcast hosting platform built with Django and [Wagtail](https://wagtail.org/), used to host the Python Podcast. I’m especially proud of its responsive image capabilities.

items.title: Weeknotes
items.description: Since 2021, I’ve been writing weeknotes to document my work and life—a valuable way to reflect on achievements and track my progress.

items.title: PlastInvest
items.description: PlastInvest is a tool designed for governments, offering quantitative and qualitative insights into the investments required to implement national action plans for reducing plastic waste and pollution.

items.title: Data Science Tutorial
items.description: This tutorial covers topics that, for one reason or another, I find relevant or intriguing. Enjoy!

items.title: kptncook
items.description: A lightweight command-line client for downloading [KptnCook](https://www.kptncook.com/) recipes, with export capabilities for [mealie](https://mealie.io/) and [Paprika](https://www.paprikaapp.com/).

items.title: PlasticIQ
items.description: PlasticIQ is a data-driven digital platform designed to help companies eliminate plastic waste.

items.title: fastdeploy
items.description: A web backend for automated project deployment with real-time progress updates, featuring a [Vue.js](https://vuejs.org/) WebSocket frontend and optional integration with htmx and polling.

items.title: Serving Files with Django
items.description: Explored various methods for serving files with Django, developed a benchmarking tool for comparison, and presented the findings at DjangoCon Europe 2021.

items.title: cast-vue
items.description: A [Vue.js](https://vuejs.org) frontend for [django-cast](https://github.com/ephes/django-cast), demonstrating the feasibility of building a complete frontend solely through the API.

items.title: Django Async
items.description: Wrote an in-depth blog post on the new async capabilities in Django 3.1, also published in print by the German magazine [entwickler.de](https://entwickler.de/python/django-wird-asynchron).

items.title: Konektom
items.description: Konektom.org is a collaborative bookmarking service built on Django, featuring an intuitive faceted navigation interface.

about.text: As a long term Python developer I've seen a lot of different projects over the years. And I always had a lot of fun building stuff, never thinking of my work just as a job. Nowadays I mostly work with Python, but don't mind using other languages and tools to build complete products.

identity.name: Jochen Wersdörfer
identity.tagline: Freelance Software developer doing mostly data science / machine learning and web development using Django.
identity.avatar_alt: Just in case you need to steal a picture of Jochen

items.title: Hey there!
items.text: I'm [Jochen Wersdörfer](https://wersdoerfer.de/jochen/), a freelance software developer based in [Düsseldorf, Germany](https://www.google.com/maps/place/D%C3%BCsseldorf/). I started working in the software and internet industry at [web.de](https://web.de/) shortly after the dotcom bubble burst - just when people realized that most of the fun was over.

items.title: A Journey Through Code
items.text: Over the years, I've tackled projects of all shapes and sizes—collaborating with industry giants like [Otto Group](https://www.ottogroup.com/) and [RTL](https://www.rtl.de/), as well as innovative startups like [trivago](https://www.trivago.com/) and [billiger.de](https://www.billiger.de/). In 2019, I had the unique experience of attending a [conference talk](https://2019.pycon.de/program/pydata-fdvfhx-10-years-of-automated-category-classification-for-product-data-johannes-knopp/) about my first big machine learning project, which had run successfully in production for over a decade before gracefully retiring.

items.title: Python and Beyond
items.text: [Python](https://www.python.org/)is my trusty sidekick—why wrestle with convoluted syntax when you can keep it sleek and readable? It's my language of choice for crafting machine learning models and building backend web applications. When I'm not coding, I'm chatting on my [German Python-Podcast](https://python-podcast.de/show/) or penning thoughts on [my blog](https://wersdoerfer.de/blogs/ephes_blog/). Lately, I've been all-in on [Django](https://www.djangoproject.com/)'s exciting evolution, especially with how tools like [htmx](https://htmx.org) are bringing server-side rendering back in style. And guess what? I've even started learning CSS to sprinkle some extra magic on the front end!

items.title: Ready to Collaborate?
items.text: If you're on the hunt for someone who can jump into your project and start making a difference from day one, look no further. While Python is my main jam, I'm also well-versed in JavaScript, SQL, and a handful of other technologies like Vue.js and PostgreSQL. Picking up new languages or tools? Challenge accepted!

items.title: Team Opportunities
items.text:
Here's something exciting I've been thinking about: Maybe you have a project that needs not just an extra individual contributor, but an entire development team. I've worked with a lot of talented people over the years, and there are a few I'd love to collaborate with again. The best part? They're eager to join forces too, so there's a fresh win-win situation just waiting to be tapped.
  

So, whether you need a seasoned developer or a full-fledged team, I'm just an email away. Click the button below or drop me a line at [jochen-resume@wersdoerfer.de](mailto:jochen-resume@wersdoerfer.de), and let's turn your ideas into reality—and maybe have some fun along the way!


Cheers,
Jochen

permission_denied.title: Access Token Needed for CV
permission_denied.sub_title: Unlock access with a simple email
permission_denied.text: Hi there! It seems that an access token is needed to view this page. Don’t worry, it’s a quick and easy step. Simply send a brief email to Jochen, and he’ll gladly assist you in obtaining the access you need. Jochen is always happy to help and will make sure you’re set up in no time. Thanks for reaching out!
